intro: Polygala nelsonii, commonly known as Nelson's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are alternate and often hairy, while its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white. Polygala nelsonii plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
